member.name: F:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Config.STRICT
member.summary: When set to true an exception will be thrown instead of logging an error. Should be used when running editor tests to make the tests fail if any error occurs.

member.name: F:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Config.RETHROW
member.summary: Rethrows any caught exceptions. Should be used when running editor tests to make sure any exception will cause the test to fail

member.name: F:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Config.VERBOSE
member.summary: When set to true additional debug information will be included in debug logs

member.name: F:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Config.PREVENT_CIRCULAR_REFERENCES
member.summary: When set to true, the creation of a circular prefab reference is prevented immediately after parenting by performing an Undo.

member.name: F:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Config.DELAY_APPLY_CHANGES
member.summary: When set to true any changes to a prefab will be delayed by 0.5 seconds before applying them. This will give the user time to modify things like strings or input fields without the changes being applied while editing. Should be disabled for Unit Tests.

member.name: F:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Config.APPLY_OVERRIDES_TO_ASSET
member.summary: When set to true all permanent prefab overrides will also be applied to the asset of the root prefab. Overrides will never be applied to the original asset.

member.name: F:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Config.SAVE_ASSETS_AFTER_APPLY
member.summary: When set to true all assets in the project will be saved after applying changes to a prefab.

member.name: T:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.DontSaveInPrefab
member.summary: Ignores the component when applying changes to a prefab.

member.name: T:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.SaveInParent
member.summary: Saves the component in the parent prefab instead of the prefab the component is on. Main uses are for Transform, RectTransform, PrefabOverrides. Should only be used for components on the root of a (Nested) Prefab.

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.ReferenceCollection.#ctor(VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Prefab)
member.summary: Creates a new Reference Collection for the Prefab

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.ReferenceCollection.SetPrefab(VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Prefab)
member.summary: Changes the target prefab for the reference collection.

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.ReferenceCollection.Validate(System.Func{UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.GameObject})
member.summary: Validates the reference collection according to the given validation method.

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.ReferenceCollection.FindObjectWithGuid(VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Guid)
member.summary: Finds an object in the collection with the given GUID.

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.ReferenceCollection.Equals(VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.ReferenceCollection)
member.summary: Is this reference collection equal to the other collection?

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.ReferenceCollection.Add(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Adds a new child to the reference collection. Should only be used on an instanced child when the child is exactly the same as the source prefab. Using this on any modified object will corrupt the reference collection.

member.summary: Reference collection of the nested prefab containing references for all children, linking them to the parent prefab object.

member.summary: Called when the NestedPrefab component is enabled. Should usually only be called once when the component is created or on editor startup

member.name: P:VisualDesignCafe.Editor.Prefabs.Prefab.PostprocessPrefabGuidDepthLimit
member.summary: Limits the prefab postprocessor to only change the GUID of Nested Prefabs up to this depth. The first Nested Prefab in the hierarchy has a depth of 1.

member.summary: Reference collection containing a list of all children in the hierarchy.

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Serialization.JsonObject.Create(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a JSONObject by parsing string data
member.param: The maximum depth for the parser to search. Set this to to 1 for the first level, 2 for the first 2 levels, etc. It defaults to -2 because -1 is the depth value that is parsed (see below)
Whether to store levels beyond maxDepth in baked JSONObjects
Whether to be strict in the parsing. For example, non-strict parsing will successfully parse "a string" into a string-type

member.name: M:VisualDesignCafe.Serialization.JsonObject.Copy

member.summary: Merge object right into left recursively
